alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Hancock; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 08 at 2:41AM CDT until April 08 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Today... .A combination of low humidity values, gusty winds and dry fuels will lead to critical fire conditions across portions of west central into north central Iowa on this afternoon into the evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR WEST CENTRAL INTO NORTH CENTRAL IOWA... The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Portions of west central into north central Iowa. * WIND...South at 10 to 20 mph with gusts in excess of 25 mph at times. * HUMIDITY...Dropping to 20 to 25 percent by the afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and uncontrollably. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
